fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: The question refers to whether the head of state is considered to hold this power in practice, regardless of whether this is regulated by law and whether this power has been exercised or not. By "dissolving the legislature" we refer to the ability of the head of state to call a new election for the legislature.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: If the head of state took actions to dissolve the legislature, would he/she be likely to succeed?

fxInfo_responses.value: Yes, but not at his/her own discretion, only when prompted to as a response to specific events (for example, after a certain number of votes of no confidence, or after a certain number of failed attempts to form a cabinet).

Yes, at his/her own discretion, but with restrictions (for example, by frequency, such as”once a year”, by time point within term, such as ”not within the last sixth months of the head of state’s term”, and by the requirement that the head of state must then himself/herself stand for election).
Yes, at his/her own discretion and without restrictions.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2exdfdshs, *_osp, *_ord
